00009 enum //enemy intentions,
00010 {
00011       NO_INTENTIONS,                //enemy intentions are undefined.
00012       PURSUIT,                                  //enemy group has spotted a player group and is pursuing them.  If they lose the player group, they
00013                                                                   //will get reassigned.
00014       STAGING,                                  //enemy is prepare to assault a town sector, but doesn't have enough troops.
00015       PATROL,                                         //enemy is moving around determining safe areas.
00016       REINFORCEMENTS,               //enemy group has intentions to fortify position at final destination.
00017       ASSAULT,                                  //enemy is ready to fight anything they encounter.
00018       NUM_ENEMY_INTENTIONS
00019 };
00020 
00021 enum //move types
00022 {
00023       ONE_WAY,                                  //from first waypoint to last, deleting each waypoint as they are reached.
00024       CIRCULAR,                                 //from first to last, recycling forever.
00025       ENDTOEND_FORWARDS,      //from first to last -- when reaching last, change to backwards.
00026       ENDTOEND_BACKWARDS      //from last to first -- when reaching first, change to forwards.
00027 };
00028 
00029 enum
00030 {
00031       NORTH_STRATEGIC_MOVE,
00032       EAST_STRATEGIC_MOVE,
00033       SOUTH_STRATEGIC_MOVE,
00034       WEST_STRATEGIC_MOVE,
00035       THROUGH_STRATEGIC_MOVE
00036 };
00037 
00038 //This structure contains all of the information about a group moving in the strategic
00039 //layer.  This includes all troops, equipment, and waypoints, and location.
00040 //NOTE:  This is used for groups that are initiating a movement to another sector.
00041 typedef struct WAYPOINT
00042 {
00043       UINT8 x;                                                                //sector x position of waypoint
00044       UINT8 y;                                                                //sector y position of waypoint
00045       struct WAYPOINT *next;                    //next waypoint in list
00046 }WAYPOINT;
00047 
00048 #define PG_INDIVIDUAL_MERGED        0x01
00049 
00050 typedef struct PLAYERGROUP
00051 {
00052       UINT8 ubProfileID;                                    //SAVE THIS VALUE ONLY.  The others are temp (for quick access)
00053       UINT8 ubID;                                                       //index in the Menptr array
00054       SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier;                    //direct access to the soldier pointer
00055       UINT8 bFlags;                                                     //flags referring to individual player soldiers
00056       struct PLAYERGROUP *next;                 //next player in list
00057 }PLAYERGROUP;
00058 
00059 
00060 typedef struct ENEMYGROUP
00061 {
00062       UINT8 ubNumTroops;                                    //number of regular troops in the group
00063       UINT8 ubNumElites;                                    //number of elite troops in the group
00064       UINT8 ubNumAdmins;                                    //number of administrators in the group
00065       UINT8 ubLeaderProfileID;                  //could be Mike, maybe the warden... someone new, but likely nobody.
00066       UINT8 ubPendingReinforcements;//This group is waiting for reinforcements before attacking or attempting to fortify newly aquired sector.
00067       UINT8 ubAdminsInBattle;                   //number of administrators in currently in battle.
00068       UINT8 ubIntention;                                    //the type of group this is:  patrol, assault, spies, etc.
00069       UINT8 ubTroopsInBattle;                   //number of soldiers currently in battle.
00070       UINT8 ubElitesInBattle;                   //number of elite soldiers currently in battle.
00071       INT8  bPadding[20];
00072 }ENEMYGROUP;
00073 
00074 //NOTE:  ALL FLAGS ARE CLEARED WHENEVER A GROUP ARRIVES IN A SECTOR, OR ITS WAYPOINTS ARE
00075 //       DELETED!!!
00076 #define GROUPFLAG_SIMULTANEOUSARRIVAL_APPROVED  0x00000001
00077 #define GROUPFLAG_SIMULTANEOUSARRIVAL_CHECKED         0x00000002
00078 //I use this flag when traversing through a list to determine which groups meet whatever conditions,
00079 //then add this marker flag.  The second time I traverse the list, I simply check for this flag,
00080 //apply my modifications to the group, and remove the flag.  If you decide to use it, make sure the 
00081 //flag is cleared.
00082 #define GROUPFLAG_MARKER                                                                        0x00000004
00083 //Set whenever a group retreats from battle.  If the group arrives in the next sector and enemies are there
00084 //retreat will not be an option.
00085 #define GROUPFLAG_JUST_RETREATED_FROM_BATTLE          0x00000008
00086 #define GROUPFLAG_HIGH_POTENTIAL_FOR_AMBUSH                 0x00000010
00087 #define GROUPFLAG_GROUP_ARRIVED_SIMULTANEOUSLY  0x00000020
00088 
00089 
00090 typedef struct GROUP
00091 {
00092       BOOLEAN fDebugGroup;                            //for testing purposes -- handled differently in certain cases.
00093       BOOLEAN fPlayer;                                      //set if this is a player controlled group.
00094       BOOLEAN fVehicle;                                     //vehicle controlled group?
00095       BOOLEAN fPersistant;                            //This flag when set prevents the group from being automatically deleted when it becomes empty.
00096       UINT8 ubGroupID;                                      //the unique ID of the group (used for hooking into events and SOLDIERTYPE)
00097       UINT8 ubGroupSize;                                    //total number of individuals in the group.
00098       UINT8 ubSectorX, ubSectorY;         //last/curr sector occupied
00099       UINT8 ubSectorZ;
00100       UINT8 ubNextX, ubNextY;                   //next sector destination
00101       UINT8 ubPrevX, ubPrevY;                   //prev sector occupied (could be same as ubSectorX/Y)
00102       UINT8 ubOriginalSector;                   //sector where group was created.
00103       BOOLEAN fBetweenSectors;                  //set only if a group is between sector.
00104       UINT8 ubMoveType;                                     //determines the type of movement (ONE_WAY, CIRCULAR, ENDTOEND, etc.)
00105       UINT8 ubNextWaypointID;                   //the ID of the next waypoint
00106       UINT8 ubFatigueLevel;                           //the fatigue level of the weakest member in group
00107       UINT8 ubRestAtFatigueLevel;         //when the group's fatigue level <= this level, they will rest upon arrival at next sector.
00108       UINT8 ubRestToFatigueLevel;         //when resting, the group will rest until the fatigue level reaches this level.
00109       UINT32 uiArrivalTime;                           //the arrival time in world minutes that the group will arrive at the next sector.
00110       UINT32 uiTraverseTime;                    //the total traversal time from the previous sector to the next sector.
00111       BOOLEAN fRestAtNight;                           //set when the group is permitted to rest between 2200 and 0600 when moving
00112       BOOLEAN fWaypointsCancelled;  //set when groups waypoints have been removed.
00113       WAYPOINT *pWaypoints;                           //a list of all of the waypoints in the groups movement.
00114       UINT8 ubTransportationMask;         //the mask combining all of the groups transportation methods.
00115       UINT32 uiFlags;                                             //various conditions that apply to the group
00116       UINT8 ubCreatedSectorID;                  //used for debugging strategic AI for keeping track of the sector ID a group was created in.
00117       UINT8 ubSectorIDOfLastReassignment; //used for debuggin strategic AI.  Records location of any reassignments.
00118       INT8 bPadding[29];                                    //***********************************************//
00119 
00120       union
00121       {
00122             PLAYERGROUP *pPlayerList;           //list of players in the group
00123             ENEMYGROUP *pEnemyGroup;            //a structure containing general enemy info
00124       };
00125       struct GROUP *next;                                   //next group
00126 }GROUP;

00135 //Remove a group from the list.  This removes all of the waypoints as well as the members of the group.
00136 //Calling this function doesn't position them in a sector.  It is up to you to do that.  The event system
00137 //will automatically handle their updating as they arrive in sectors.
00138 void RemoveGroup( UINT8 ubGroupID );//takes a groupID
00139 void RemovePGroup( GROUP *pGroup ); //same function, but takes a GROUP*
00140 void RemoveGroupIdFromList( UINT8 ubId );
00141 
00142 //Clears a groups waypoints.  This is necessary when sending new orders such as different routes.
00143 void RemoveGroupWaypoints( UINT8 ubGroupID );
00144 void RemovePGroupWaypoints( GROUP *pGroup ); //same function, but takes a GROUP*

00279 //position in the route and TREATS the pGroup->ubMoveType as ONE_WAY EVEN IF IT ISN'T.  If the
